label: Hello
text: Hello, thank you for signing up to speak with us today. Before we get started can we share a bit about the ways we can offer you support here on our PeerChat service?

label: Remit
text:
Thank you for reaching out to The Mix’s PeerChat. Today, you’ll have 45 minutes to talk to a trained volunteer about your thoughts and feelings, what’s been going for you and why you have reached out. We can also look for more options that may be able to help further. If you become disconnected at any time during the chat please rejoin the link in your confirmation email.


The Mix is unable to provide urgent help. If you need urgent help, please visit https://www.themix.org.uk/get-support/urgent-help/


Here at The Mix, we don’t tell anyone outside of the charity what you have shared with us. However, if we felt that you or someone else were in danger, then we would widen the circle of confidentiality by contacting the emergency services. If this were the case, we would tell you straight away and ask you for your details if we haven't got them already. 

For further information, please visit https://www.themix.org.uk/about-us/privacy-centre/privacy-policy/

label: Silent - Check In
text: I noticed you’ve gone quiet, I just wanted to check if now is still a good time to talk. If you become disconnected at any time please rejoin the link sent in your confirmation email.

label: Signposting - Types of help
text: We can look for different types of support, such as advice, counselling, emotional support and practical help. Do you know which of these you would prefer?

label: Signposting- How support can be accessed.
text: Support can be accessed in a few different ways such as face-to-face, over the phone or online. Do you know which of these you’d prefer?

label: Urge 999
text: Here at The Mix we take your thoughts of suicide seriously. We hear you and your feelings are important. We just wanted to let you know that if you did feel at any point that you were going to act on your thoughts of suicide, then we would urge you to call the emergency services on 999, or go to your local A&E department to explain your intentions to them, so that they can support you.

label: Breaking Confidentiality Part 1
text:
Here at The Mix, we take what you share seriously. We are concerned about what you’ve told us and believe that [your/ someone’s/ xxxx’s] life is in danger. Because of this, this conversation is no longer confidential, and we are limited in the options we can offer you. We are going to share this information with the emergency services to support you further. We would appreciate it if you could share your details to aid in this process.

Thank you , we will now be passing the details you have provided us with onto the Police. I am going to bring this conversation to an end as they may get in touch to provide you with support. You’ve been so brave to share your experiences today.

label: Breaking Confidentiality Part 2
text: We would urge you to call the emergency services on 999, or go to your local A&E department to explain your intentions to them, so that they can support you. Please take care. Bye for now.

label: Bye Message
text:
You’ve been really brave in taking the time to reach out to us here at The Mix today. After this chat ends, you will receive an email that outlines what was spoken about in this chat and the resources you asked for. We hope these resources will be able to support you further.

Take good care.

label: Bye - Survey link
text: Just before you go, here at The Mix, we want to make sure we’re providing services that suit your needs and preferences. To get that right we’d love to ask you a few questions about your preferences when it comes to services and your experience with them. Could we contact you after this conversation via email to send you a link to our short survey?
